result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Brian Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:36 PM Joshua Brian Hopkins, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel David Andrew Bolles.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.    State complied with Victim Witness Notification.
Amended Complaint filed.  Plea Questionaire filed.  No Contest plea entered on Counts 1-3.    Court advises defendant of rights.
  Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law.   Defendant advised of voting rights.    Defendant advised of firearm restriction.   Elements stated.  Factual basis found.  Joint sentence recommendation - Ct 1 - 3 W/H sentence 3 yr probation.  Court sentences.  All costs & DNA remitted except for Count 1 DNA costs.    Return cash bond to poster.
Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

01:33 PM Joshua Brian Hopkins, defendant appeared in Court by phone along with counsel David Andrew Bolles.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney.
All PT motions, MIL, Jury instructions, witness lists due Sept 6, 2019.  Status set and JT dates.  
Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2019 at 02:30 pm.  3 day Jury trial scheduled as #3 priority for Oct 8-10, 2019.  3 day Jury trial scheduled as #2 priority for Nov 4-5, 2019.
Not witnessed
not witnessed

David Andrew Bolles appearing on behalf of defendant.
Joshua Brian Hopkins, defendant does not appear.
State request the surety be changed in the bond to reflect the name of defendants father and no longer Jamie Leffler. Clerk is to email the bonds to Attorney Bolles for the parties to sign and be witnessed be Attorney Bolles.

and for exchanges of the minor child, N.H. Such contacts shall not be violent or
abusive.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 4, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
in custody - Green County Jail

01:32 PM Joshua Brian Hopkins, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Atty Taylor addresses bond - father confirms DE would reside with him in Madison.  Employed FT and willing to co-sign.  Mr Fields in person confirms full time employment waiting for DE.  DA Nolen still requests cash bond as set due to active warrant previously issued.  Atty Taylor responds - amount should be reduced to allow family to raise funds.   Court - continues the gravity and flight risk - bond remains as originally set and would consider other options if evidence of financial ability to pay should there be a flight risk.
No plea taken - matter to track CF case.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2019 at 11:00 am.

Violation - Criminal trespass to dwelling; DC; Battery.  Issuing Agency - GCSD.
  NO CONTACT WITH: C.F. or T.C.   No contact with residence at: W702 Atkinson Rd in the Town of Albany WI.

Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
Court grants cash bond with conditions as requested.  Atty Taylor requests continued initial appr this week for bond to be reconsidered.
DA Nolen notes warrant can be cancelled.

01:16 PM Joshua Brian Hopkins, defendant appeared in Court appeared by video means with counsel Guy Mason Taylor by phone.

Adjourned initial appearance and Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 28, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
